action.action-desc: Ms. Meng introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To prohibit the employment of school bus drivers with serious moving violations.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No School Bus Drivers with DUIs Act.

section.header: Prohibited employment of school bus drivers with serious moving violations

subsection.text: Subpart 2 of part F of title VIII of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7101 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Prohibited employment of school bus drivers with serious moving violations

subsection.text: No State, State educational agency, or local educational agency that receives funds made available by this Act may employ an individual as a school bus driver if that individual has been convicted of, or pled guilty to, drunk driving or a driving violation that is a felony under State law.
The Secretary shall not have the authority to mandate, direct, or control the specific measures adopted by a State, State educational agency, or local educational agency pursuant to this section.

Nothing in this section shall be construed to prevent a State, State educational agency, or local education agency from adopting a law, regulation, or policy that provides greater or additional protections prohibiting the employment of a school employee, contractor, or agent.
The table of contents in section 2 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended by inserting after the item related to section 8549C the following:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 8549D. Prohibited employment of school bus drivers with serious moving violations.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this Act shall take effect on the date that is 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act.
